translated: like a door with a bolt,
I will not let you go to evil,
O net of sensual pleasures, O king of the body.
like an elephant unable to find the opening of a door;
And, mind, you will not again and again

original: Pasakka pāparato carissasi.🔽Yathā kuñjaraṁ adantaṁ,🔽Navaggahamaṅkusaggaho;🔽Balavā āvatteti akāmaṁ,🔽Evaṁ āvattayissaṁ taṁ.
analyzed: pasakka pāpa rataḥ carissasi  yathā kuñjaram adanta  nava ggaham aṅkusa ggahaḥ  balavān āvattā iti akāma  evam āvattayissam te

translated: I will bind you with mindfulness,
restrained by the swiftness of energy,

analyzed: na yitas dūram gamissase citta ati
translated: you will not go far, mind.”🔽… the elder Vijitasena …
